squash.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to press something into a flatter shape, often breaking or damaging it
squash.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The cake got a bit squashed on the way here.
Her hair had been squashed down by her hat.
squash.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to push yourself or something else into a space that is too small
squash.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Seven of us squashed into the car.
We can probably squash another couple of things in.
squash.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to use your power or authority to stop something
squash.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The government was quick to squash any hopes of reform.
squash.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to control or ignore an emotion
squash.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: She felt anger rising but quickly squashed it.
squash.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a game played by two people who use rackets to hit a small rubber ball against the walls of a square court
squash.translation[1].definitions[1].def: one of a group of large vegetables with solid flesh and hard skins, such as pumpkins
squash.translation[1].definitions[2].def: a drink made from fruit juice, sugar, and water
